intro: Secamone sulfurea subsp. sulfurea, commonly known as the yellow secamone, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is native to parts of Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
